{"step_by_step_thinking": "The EPI (Expanded Program on Immunization) schedule is a national immunization program that includes vaccines for various diseases. To determine which vaccine is not included in the EPI schedule, we need to know which vaccines are typically included in the schedule. A. DPT (Diphtheria, Pertussis, and Tetanus) vaccine is commonly included in the EPI schedule. B. MMR (Measles, Mumps, and Rubella) vaccine is also commonly included in the EPI schedule. C. BCG (Bacillus Calmette-Guérin) vaccine, which is used to prevent tuberculosis, is typically included in the EPI schedule. D. OPV (Oral Polio Vaccine) is another vaccine that is commonly included in the EPI schedule. Based on this information, we can conclude that the vaccine not included in the EPI schedule is option B. MMR vaccine.", "answer_choice": "B"}
